placeDesc: Traces of “Polish Broadway”, as this stretch of Division Street between Ashland and Damen Avenues was once called, remain, including the old-school Alliance Bakery for tasty treats, and the otherworldly “dive bar” Zakopane, which feels unchanged in decor and attitude from the 1970s.  Across from the Nelson Algren fountain, a tiny family-owned restaurant, Podhalanka, still carries the torch, serving cheap and filling plates of specialties like pierogi, stuffed cabbage, and borscht.The area has changed and Podhalanka now sits incongruously next to the nightclub Evil Olive, host of the city’s decadent hipster club night, “Porn & Chicken”.
placeShortDesc: Where old school Polish Chicago and young hipster Chicago live side by side.
placeNearby: Chopin Theatre,Nelson Algren Memorial Fountain,Former Location of Polish Daily Zgoda Newspaper
placeRelatedPlaces: Mystery Craters,Marcell Experimental Forest,Cerro de las Campanas (Hill of Bells),Guelta d'Archei
